RajadhyakshaAnish Paul WillemenBFI1999

Rajadhyaksha, Anish, and Paul Willemen, eds. Encyclopedia of Indian Cinema. 2nd rev. ed. London: BFI, 1999.

 

1980

Roud, Richard, ed. Cinema: A Critical Dictionary. New York: Viking, 1980.

 

. . 1972

Sadoul, Georges. Dictionary of Film Makers. Trans. and ed. Peter Morris. Berkeley: University of California Press, 1972.

 

. . 1972

Sadoul, Georges. Dictionary of Films. Trans. and ed. Peter Morris. Berkeley: University of California Press, 1972.

 

. 1929-19681968

Sarris, Andrew. The American Cinema: Directors and Directions, 19291968. New York: Dutton, 1968.

 

F. -WH 1966

Speed, F. Maurice, and James Cameron-Wilson. Film Review. London: W. H. Allen, 1966. Annual.

 

1982

Steinberg, Cobbett. Reel Facts: The Movie Book of Records. Updated. New York: Vintage, 1982.

 

BFI BFI2000

Taylor, Richard, et al., eds. The BFI Companion to Eastern European and Russian Cinema. London: BFI, 2000.

 

51990-94

Thomas, Nicholas, ed. The International Dictionary of Films and Filmmakers. 2nd ed. 5 vols. Chicago: St. James Press, 199094.

 

. 2004

Thomson, David. The New Biographical Dictionary of Film: Expanded and Updated. New York: Knopf, 2004.

 

1949

Willis, John, ed. Screen World Film Annual. London: Applause, 1949.

 

The most important and up-to-date sources for film research, along with scholarly books, are journals and magazines. A writer gradually becomes familiar with the differences among them, learning to judge which ones will be most helpful for which topics. The essays and reviews found here provide a range of information: interviews with actors, script-writers, and directors; background facts on the production of a movie; and investigations of complex critical issues (the politics or the formal features of the movie, for instance). A first step in researching articles on a specific movie or topic is to scan a good index, which will list most of the essays and reviews on your subject and will indicate the periodicals in which they are found. Keep in mind, however, that the titles or information you seek may be located under headings such as Motion Pictures or Movies.

MLA

Besides more general indexes, such as the Guide to Periodical Literature and the film section of the MLA International Bibliography, the following are a few of the standard indexes for film research:

J. Filmdex1973

Aceto, Vincent J., Jane Graves, and Fred Silva. Film Literature Index. Albany, N.Y.: Filmdex, 1973. Quarterly.

 

. 1930-1971RR Bowker1975

Batty, Linda. Retrospective Index to Film Periodicals, 19301971. New York: R. R. Bowker, 1975.

 

E.1930-1972 1973

Bowles, Stephen E., ed. Index to Critical Film Reviews in British and American Periodicals, 19301972. New York: Burt Franklin, 1973.

 

E. 1930-19721975

Bowles, Stephen E., ed. Index to Critical Reviews of Books about Film, 19301972. New York: Burt Franklin, 1975.

 

E.1994

Bowles, Stephen E., ed. The Film Anthologies Index. Metuchen, N.J.: Scarecrow Press, 1994.

 

J GK 1972

Bukalski, Peter J. Film Research: A Critical Bibliography with Annotation and Essay. Boston: G. K. Hall, 1972.

 

3 1941-85

The Film Index: A Bibliography. 3 vols. New York: The Museum of Modern Art Film Library, 194185.

 

C (Gerlach) (Gerlach)1948-19731974

Gerlach, John C., and Gerlach, Lana. The Critical Index: 19481973. New York: Teachers College Press, 1974.

 

FIAF RR Bowker1972

International Index to Film Periodicals (FIAF Index). New York: R. R. Bowker, 1972. Annual.

 

1976

Kowalski, Rosemary Ribich. Women and Film: A Bibliography. Metuchen, N.J.: Scarecrow Press, 1976.

 

S 1930-19701974

MacCann, Richard Dyer, and Edward S. Perry. The New Film Index: A Bibliography of Magazine Articles in English, 19301970. New York: Dutton, 1974.

 

Pierian Press1970

Media Review Digest. Ann Arbor, Mich.: Pierian Press, 1970. Annual.

 

1976

Monaco, James, and Susan Schenker, eds. Books about Film: A Bibliographical Checklist. 3rd ed. New York: Zoetrope, 1976.

 

. 21982

Rehrauer, George. The Macmillan Film Bibliography. 2 vols. London: Macmillan, 1982.

 

. 1900-1972 1973

Schuster, Mel. Motion Picture Directors: A Bibliography of Magazine and Periodical Articles, 19001972. Metuchen, N.J.: Scarecrow Press, 1973.

 

When consulting these indexes, it is best to begin with more recent years and then move back through the years to find relevant essays; the more current articles often have more up-to-date information. Noting the entries over a period of several years is usually a good start. A just-released movie, however, may not even appear in the most current index, and in this case, you must examine the tables of contents of the most recent journals and the movie reviews in newspapers that have appeared in the past few months. (Some journals, such as Cinema Journal and Film Quarterly, feature regular listings or reviews of very recent articles and books about film.) Caution: Invariably, an index will use extreme abbreviations for the journals; be certain to check the key to those abbreviations before leaving the index.

VarietyProject Muse

Film journals vary considerably in quality and focus, and the following list of titles indicates the variety and range of journals that a film researcher will encounter. Some journals offer difficult theoretical essays, others have mainly interviews and short review articles, and still others (like Variety) are a regular source of trade and industry information. Although those marked with an asterisk feature articles particularly useful to college students, you should investigate all that seem to deal with your topic. By using them, you will become familiar with their advantages and limitations. In addition to these more specialized periodicals, most magazines and newspapers, such as Newsweek or the New York Times, are regular sources for movie reviews and short, general articles. Journals are also becoming more readily available electronically, either through online subscriptions directly with the journal publisher or through intermediaries, such as library databases like Project Muse. Check with your library for a listing of journals available to students online. In addition, many journals have their own websites that frequently include tables of contents for back issues and even sample articles.

In the following list, journals marked with an asterisk are especially recommended:



*http://www.adaptation.oxfordjournals.org[]



* Adaptation (http://www.adaptation.oxfordjournals.org). Theoretical, critical, and review essays concerned with the exchanges between literature and film, as well as other forms of cinematic adaptation [two issues annually].

 

( http://www.theasc.com/magazine )[]

American Cinematographer (http://www.theasc.com/magazine). Short essays and industry information [monthly].

 

[1975-92]

American Film. Review articles and short essays [197592].

 

( http://www.brightlightsfilm.com )[]

Bright Lights Film Journal (http://www.brightlightsfilm.com). Review articles, short essays, and film festival and book reviews [online only].

 

*( http://www.cahiersducinema.com )[]

* Cahiers du Cinma (http://www.cahiersducinema.com). Theoretical essays, current film reviews, and occasional interviews [monthly, French].

 

*( http://cameraobscura.dukejournals.org/ )[]

* Camera Obscura (http://cameraobscura.dukejournals.org/). Theoretical and feminist essays on film, television, and popular culture [three issues annually].

 

* Cineaste ( http://www.cineaste.com )[]

* Cineaste (http://www.cineaste.com). Critical essays (usually directed at ideological issues), interviews, and current film reviews [quarterly].

 

* Cinefex ( http://www.cinefex.com/magazine.html )[]

* Cinefex (http://www.cinefex.com/magazine.html). Focuses on special-effects technology in the cinema [quarterly].

 

*http://muse.jhu.edu/journals/cj[]

* Cinema Journal (http://muse.jhu.edu/journals/cj). Critical essays [quarterly].

 

*( http://www.cinema-scope.com )[]

* Cinema Scope (http://www.cinema-scope.com). Critical essays on international cinema [five issues annually].

 

*[]

* Film Criticism. Critical essays, reviews, and special issues on topics such as feminist film criticism and filmmakers such as Douglas Sirk [three times annually].

 

*http://www.filmlinc.com/fcm/fcm.htm DVD []

* Film Comment (http://www.filmlinc.com/fcm/fcm.htm). Critical essays and reviews of current films, film festivals, and DVD releases [bimonthly].

 

*http://www.film-philosophy.com/archive

* Film Philosophy (http://www.film-philosophy.com/archive). An international journal with a wide range of book reviews, theoretical essays, and sophisticated analyses of individual films.

 

*http://www.filmquarterly.org[]

* Film Quarterly (http://www.filmquarterly.org). Critical essays, occasional interviews, and current film reviews [quarterly].

 

[1975-85]

Film Reader. Critical essays [197585].

*http://www.frameworkonline.com[]

* []

* Frauen und Film. Theoretical and critical essays, feminist emphasis [quarterly, German].

 

*http://www.imagesjournal.com[]

* Images: Journal of film and popular culture (http://www.imagesjournal.com). Review articles, short essays, and interviews [online only].

 

*[]

* Iris. Critical and theoretical essays [irregularly, French and English].

 

*http://www.press.uillinois.edu/journals/jfv.html[]

* Journal of Film and Video (http://www.press.uillinois.edu/journals/jfv.html). Critical essays on film, television, and video [quarterly].

 

http://www.heldref.org/jpft.php[]

Journal of Popular Film and Television (http://www.heldref.org/jpft.php). Critical essays on film and television from a cultural-studies viewpoint [quarterly].

 

*( http://www.ejumpcut.org )[]

* Jump Cut (http://www.ejumpcut.org). Critical essays often directed to political and ideological issues, current film reviews, some interviews [online only].

 

*/http://www.salisbury.edu/lfq[]

* Literature/Film Quarterly (http://www.salisbury.edu/lfq). Critical essays on topics related to the intersections of film and literature [quarterly].

 

*( http://www.midnighteye.com )

* Midnight Eye (http://www.midnighteye.com). Essays, film and book reviews, and interviews focusing on contemporary Japanese cinema.

 

*( http://mfj-online.org )[]

* Millennium Film Journal (http://mfj-online.org). Theoretical and critical essays focusing on independent, experimental, and avant-garde film and video [irregularly].

 

( http://www.offscreen.com )

Offscreen (http://www.offscreen.com). An online film journal that covers genres, directors, and individual films, along with reviews of festivals and other journals.

 

*[1984-97]

*[]

* Positif. Critical and theoretical essays [monthly, French].

 

*( http://www.tandf.co.uk/journals/titles/10509208.asp )[]

( http://www.rouge.com.au )

Rouge (http://www.rouge.com.au). An international film journal with film critiques, interviews, and broader topics by a spectrum of film scholars.

 

*http://www.scope.nottingham.ac.uk/index.php[]

*http://www.gla.ac.uk/services/screen[]

*( http://www.sensesofcinema.com )[]

*( http://www.bfi.org.uk/sightandsound )[]

http://www.vectorsjournal.org

Vectors: Journal of Culture and Technology in a Dynamic Vernacular (http://www.vectorsjournal.org). A conceptually innovative journal that combines scholarship and analysis with new design and delivery technologies.

 

*http://www.utexas.edu/utpress/journals/jvlt.html[]
